etymology.description: pictograph: melon suspended by its vines.
etymology.interpretation: Originally a drawing of a hanging gourd with trailing vines, showing a round fruit with tendrils. The central strokes suggest the fruit, while the curved side strokes evoke the vine holding it up.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢吃西瓜(我喜歡吃西瓜)。
南方的气候适合种瓜(南方的氣候適合種瓜)。
examples.pinyin: Nánfāng de qìhòu shìhé zhòng guā.
examples.english: The southern climate is suitable for growing melons.

examples.chinese: 这个瓜还没熟(這個瓜還沒熟)，先别摘(先別摘)。
examples.pinyin: Zhège guā hái méi shú, xiān bié zhāi.
examples.english: This melon isn’t ripe yet; don’t pick it yet.
